ht5q7FTjoMBPl4cw36Sprw.text: A number of these places have opened up around the central London area. This one is next to kings cross and is probably the least comfortable, nevertheless it still serves great food with all the usual favourites including ricotta pancakes and corn fritters. The coffee of course is very good and as an added bonus they open from 10:00!!

_2mX3HGFhb4XhgtBtA2Onw.text: Generally very good food but not a place to go on your own. Super rude and bewilderingly condescending management and staff. If you are traveling in and around king's cross/ St pancras might be best to hit some of the many other more friendly options.

TgKiXi1gAmw5RPJvrvlStw.text: We sat outside.  It was filthy with chips, pieces of food and bread lying around and we had an unwiped table.  Vegetarian taco main had clearly been plated hours (if not days) before and was unappealing and tasteless.  Waitstaff got order delivery wrong and dishes that belonged together did not come out at the same time. An altogether unforgettably bad experience.  Please avoid at all costs.

hXaH1JeKTxMPPIW5ZM_Q8Q.text: They don't take reservations but the king's cross store is always more busy during weekdays than weekends. Saturday night there was no waiting at all. Food was well worth the value, service was really friendly and the place looked very trendy. I really enjoyed my experience there. Although I also heard feedbacks from my friends who tried their food more often, a few starters are not as nice as the ones we've got (prawn and bah choi). Hence I'm rating this restaurant for 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Prawn burger, risotto, starters and pistachio dark chocolate fudge
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Nice bar!

AEyWwHeuKcTpGsG0kRvUZg.text: Ricotta pancakes are amazing!! The eggs are unique and the juice is fresh. Service is quick and friendly.

O6bw5qvNrTw0Fu5zS_ZvGQ.text: The new development in Kings Cross is lovely. Great outdoor spaces for the summer, especially great in the sunshine.This was my first visit to Granger and Co. Seemingly a chain of restaurants popping up throughout London's hottest locations.I visited on a Sunny Sunday afternoon and we walked straight into a table for 3 but I would expect to queue a little at the weekends (especially if the weather is nice).By all accounts an Australian business and the menu reflected this. A good selection of dishes, mostly salad based. Don't come here expecting a dirty burger.We started with the Korean chicken, which was pleasant enough. Certainly not the best I've ever had. That accolade is still held by Yum Jungle. Chicken was followed by more chicken in my case with the Chicken Schnitzel. A very tasty dish and very generously portioned. Presented with creamed corn to die for! A good selection of drinks available (you can never argue with Gamma Ray at lunch time!)Well priced for the quality and the size of the dish, in my opinion.I certainly wouldn't rush back here but if passing and hungry I'd definitely pop in for more of the same.

HG0AYbnFqgWCo4ItFX5UDg.text: We had an amazing lunch here today in Granger's sunny kings cross branch. I had the shrimp burger. It was really tasty, with chunky prawns inside and a nice Mayo with a bit of a kick but just right for me. Seated quickly and attentive staff. Also really enjoyed the courgette fries which went with our food well. Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp burger
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hotcakes

JUN1-TfOwp-5VPwfNgUs5w.text: This place was not great. I got the açaí bowl. The flavor was average at best and the portion was tiny! The waitress that seated us was quite rude, and service was mediocre. Honestly, there are better places for much less money. Save yourself a disappointment and eat somewhere else.

M9uRK4rPx6n900l_w1Kpvg.text: I went there with my friends. Four of us enjoyed the experience here. Since they don't take reservation, we had to wait for awhile. We waited for 15 min which is not bad. There is a bar so we could order drink first. Drink menu was unusual. Their Bloody Mary contains Korean chili paste that's unexpected.This place is Australian but they have all sorts of food from different continents that is a kinda entertaining. Fried rice was nice to have and filled stomach well. The service was ok. I think we received decent service. The venue isn't large so it can be noisy so perfect for Friday night girls night out as interior is quiet modern and pretty.

aORpfpL-z9LF1V27y3phhg.text: Walking in to Granger & Co you can feel the warmth of the atmosphere, which is quite a feat considering there's floor to ceiling windows that will 90% of the year serve to expose the grey skies and wind battered commuters passing by, yeah I'd say it's a brave move. Decor is used to enhance the shape, size and the environment of the restaurant, the mirrors above the bar reflect the skyline outside, the huge windows allow the hustle and bustle of Kings Cross in and the use of heavy brass seems to nod to the era where this area was industrial and hardy, used for trade, importing and transporting goods.The natural light provided by the glass exterior is enhanced with warmer lighting and candles when it gets a little later, allowing you to be sheltered from the noise and agitating buzz of the outside pace, yet still be amongst the movement of the city. Though the area has plenty of lush trees to keep it slightly romantic it's still very much a busy place, yet strangely when looking out upon it all from where I sat I felt more grateful for the quiet and calm surrounds. Curious logic... Or it could've been the wine.Anyway enough analysing over the decor! Though - never underestimate its importance.  Let's move on..I'd come to choose the restaurant, not only because it's new (definitely not 'cause he's an Aussie!) but I was having dinner with a couple of friends, one of whom was coming in on the train to St. Pancras and as my housemate and I live a stone's throw away it seemed silly to go elsewhere! We'd ticked off most of the restaurants in Granary Square and so naturally we moved ourselves on to new options at the newly opened Pancras Square, this was first on my list when I saw their menu!For starters you could look at the delicious calamari and presume to know it was nice, well presented and had a good amount of dressing to go, but honestly, you'd have to try it yourself to really  know what I'm talking about when I say, melt. in. the. mouth. Delicate seasoning. Two more plates please.This is a perfect example how amazing such simple food can taste when it's treated just the way it should be. Beautiful.Moving on to our mains, there was a whole lot of 'umm'ing and 'ahhh'ing over what dish might be the chosen one - the options are pretty dribble inducing. Thankfully we had the wine to keep any inappropriate behaviour at bay. Both the girls went for the yellow fish curry with spiced butternut squash, roast peanuts and cucumber relish with brown rice.I made the mistake of trying some.. Damn you food envy! This was so exquisite, layers of toasted spices making their way through the creamy coconut in the sauce, paired with the crisp and refreshing cucumber relish, the delicate yet meaty fish and deep textures of the butternut squash..  (I might take myself back there for this dish, table for one!)Considering that I'd had Thai for dinner the past two nights I decided the gochujang braised beef shin was for me, served with charred shallots, spring onions and brown rice.Now this was something else completely and it offered up equally as much deep felt satisfaction. A hot brothy bowl of rich, meaty bone juices, which fondly reminded me of my nan giving me hot bovril in a cup with bread when I'd get home from school to warm me in the winter, and trust me when I say that's a huge compliment. This put a genuine smile on my face, it felt so wholesomely virtuous and deeply nourishing to eat.I scooped up mouthfuls at a time on my spoon, tearing bits of bits of shallot, coriander, spring onion and pulling bits of beef shin which was so soft and delicate it almost melted. It all sat beautifully in what was a rather deep spoon, leaving room for a good scoop of that amazing broth on  top of it all..  one healthy, hearty hug of a meal.The service here was absolutely wonderful. At no point did we feel rushed, we were offered advice on wines, in depth descriptions of the dishes and then left to our own devices, during the three hours we sat there chatting our wine and water amazingly seemed topped up at all times with little or no disruption to our conversations.After we'd finished dinner, we were left to enjoy our drinks, so full

zKCqzSJsV8mwrj0c-DtWow.text: I've never been ignored by a nicer group of people.  I did come during the always  difficult hours for a restaurant - between 2 and 5.  I sat at the relatively empty bar and was not spoken to for 5 minutes.  Then a nice person asked me if I had been helped, and gave me water. After another 5 minutes, I had to stop someone. The server was efficient and I got my food quickly,  so they could go back to the ignoring.  As it was shift change time, they were all enjoying catching up with one another. The wine is a good value, and the food was good.

Ygiy5KOKkX4Yq0YmSiZ-Qg.text: Granger and Co is known for their famous ricotta hot cakes. Yes they are light and fluffy perfectly paired with honeycomb butter. The scramble egg is also nice creamy. Overall, food are good but a bit over priced

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

PtdlQaPU5kSjTAEjyNHadg.text: I'm currently studying abroad in London and I love trying to find awesome spots to eat. This is definitely at the top of my list. Had brunch here the other day and absolutely loved it. I usually like my hotcakes super thin, but I fell I love with just how fluffy these were. The honeycomb butter was a great touch as well. The atmosphere in the place is great, and my food was well worth the price (and that's coming from someone abroad)

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hotcakes...so good

gOzUriL8m-ClPSubnyD9Qg.text: Made the mistake of walking in with a competitor's take away coffee. In my defence, it was a 20+ minute wait for a table and I bought it while waiting for my friends to arrive. The hostess took the cup from me without explanation so I thought she was binning it. When I asked what was going on she said her manager wouldn't like to see the offensive logo so she wanted to pour it in a paper cup. I wasn't bothered by being told I couldn't bring in coffee. However, I was bothered by the aggressive way she grabbed my coffee and by the snide comment a waiter made about not being a fan of that brand and did I want to order a "real" coffee.Not a great way to be welcomed. I also had a hair in my breakfast to top it off. To their credit, they didn't charge me for my meal or the "real" coffee I ordered.

2H0fB_YKEnWJJPk28Jjtsg.text: Well... I've mixed feelings. We went on a wet Sunday morning and had to wait outside for just 10minutes thankfully. Once seated everything was relatively quick, although we had to get the waiters attention to make our order. We had the French Aussie, one with poached eggs and one with scrambled. Yes everything was fresh and tasty but at nearly £14 I thought it was well over-priced and nothing I couldn't do at home.I'd say the scrambled eggs were the winning food on this occasion - very well made and that's the only reason I'd come here again.I've not had dinner here, so can't comment on that but I think for what it is, it's just a little too pricey for my liking.

-ZTcgxtLypYmEhhG4kX11w.text: Much like their restaurant in Farringdon, I can't praise this chain enough.   The decor is really clean cut and modern, but still manages to be welcoming and cosy and the large windows make for great people watching even on the rainiest days. I've yet to have brunch here but it has come highly recommended. If my dinner was anything to go by, it's worth getting out of bed for!   The staff are friendly and on hand to answer any questions you may have about the menu not to mention always willing to help find you an alternative should you suffer from any allergies or food intolerance's. Don't forget to try their coffee chocolate cocktail - I can't remember the exact name but it smells as delicious as it tastes!

IqJFG7yqwrf4QEMDJ8bYMA.text: I think this is the beginning of the end for the goodness of Granger & Co as it expands its empire.  It is not in as beautiful a space as the other Granger & Co sites because it is a new build.  The service was shaky because we went on one of their first days.My problem is that the food doesn't necessarily fill you up.  We had to have the tacos, a salad and the ricotta pancakes for lunch to satisfy our tummies and then that comes with a 60 quid bill for two people with some iced teas and a coffee to wash it down.  Sad.

yEbo7EQwgfoB0tn9HNIc_g.text: A great place for an early breakfast before catching the Eurostar. Service was a touch slow getting food out of the kitchen in my opinion, but the space and wait staff were very attentive.

pWO3Nt-schvrlvjsOvh_WQ.text: We went to the kings cross location with 5 people at 9:30 on a Sunday and were seated right away. I had the ricotta hotcakes that everyone raves about and they didn't disappoint. They came with 3 large hotcakes with a banana as well. I couldn't actually finish all 3, since they were so filling! Really tasty!

rv7c4n_-4Qi2yeLDywkYDQ.text: Was visiting London for a few days and met a friend for dinner here. Dinner although very pricey was delicious. The appetizers were the best part and we started with the shrimp tempura and kimchi dumplings which were amazing. We then had the shrimp pasta, fish curry, and burger which were also good. A great start to my vacation in London. The house wine was good and reasonably priced as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi dumplings
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp tempura

3FyrFzB5haz0uWBXEfEvVQ.text: We've been here twice in the past month and we would go a little out of our way to eat here again.  My wife raves about the shrimp burger and I've had 2 different fish platters - one was a very nicely poached fish on a bed of greens with a miso soy sauce.  Everything was prepared perfectly.  Meals are a good value and the staff have a very good attitude, making a very pleasant dining experience after a long EuroStar ride or an adventure at the British Library.

s7tNTirNBqsvMoher0Yepg.text: After reading about this place as a good brunch spot, my experience was disappointing. Service was good, if not especially friendly or welcoming. But my latte with almond milk was sour (and with a 60p surcharge for the almond milk, they could do better; my own homemade lattes aren't bitter). The prawns in the linguini were overcooked, although the pasta was nicely done. Overall, not what I expected.

OSfiY1xf3c3B--yI-BxpPw.text: Bill has a solid reputation in Australia, however this half hearted effort in Kings Cross is a disappointment on many levels. The dining area is cavernous and vast with a shoddily assembled interior. I can generally excuse this if the food is outstanding. On the food front, it really falls apart. The flavours are muted, the portions small and the wait staff seem generally disinterested and lack knowledge of the menu. I'm not sure whether Bill has his exchange rates confused, but the prices are totally disconnected from the small portion sizes and general food quality.  Thankfully London has enough decent restaurants to allow you to avoid whatever this place has to offer. Two stars because I'm a patriotic Aussie.

jwWIcviMLIVKS9TzhPR0uQ.text: Managed to finally try this place for dinner! I actually wanted to try their brunch menu but the dinner didn't disappoint.Mains:(1) Soft shell crab, chorizo and kimchi fried rice with poached egg - Absolutely delicious! The rice was risotto like and the flavours made you want to immediately take another bite.£15.5(2) Prawn and chilli linguini with garlic and rocket - A simple but yummy dish. Loved the linguini and light fresh flavours of this dish but the shrimp wasn't extraordinary.£15.5(3) Grass fed beef burger - Was too well done so I would try the other dishes instead.£14Desserts:(1) Salted caramel ice cream sundae with popcorn and roasted peanuts - I was very full at this point but this was still really good that I finished it till the very last drop.£7.5(2) Chocolate ganache, passionfruit and hazelnut praline - Great dessert too. Loved the balance of flavours between the chocolate and the passionfruit, as well as the crunch of the hazelnut.£6.5--voodie rating: 8.5/10£30 per head

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

OKGy2ntZ8pPpeqwA_xrSjg.text: This was my least favorite spot in my week of travel in London.To sum up - the service was bad and the atmosphere (people wise) was not my cup of tea.So being from SF, I'm surrounded by all the "tech bros" that deservedly get a bad reputation for ruining the city's overall vibe. So I travel halfway across the globe and find myself with the same assholes that I wanted to get away from. I guess I should've expected this since the Google headquarters was literally around the corner of this spot.On top of all this, the bartender downstairs forgot our food order. I knew she would forget since it was so busy and she didn't bother to write it down. When we asked about it 25 minutes later, she said she never put the order in. No apology or comp or anything.Needless to say there's little to come here for with the exception of the layout. But if a tech bro atmosphere and lousy service are what you're looking for, then have at it!

L7NnGx72FfinmOY0n6fVbg.text: While the rest of the menu looks great, I ordered the ricotta hotcakes. Which I assume is what a lot of people order when they come here???? A good choice to be honest. They were so fluffy but also filling and didn't taste heavily of cheese. The butter was a honeycomb butter which I think is a thing now??? It was good all the same. The maple syrup was really nice and not too 'fake sugary' and went well with the hotcakes as well as the bananas!! I wanted to try the passionfruit soda as well, but they ran out. Instead I got the hibiscus + lime which probably ended up being a better choice, since it was such a hot day!! The drink is super refreshing and not too sweet, like hibiscus drinks usually are! The lime adds a nice tartiness to it  which again is welcome, cause it makes it all the more refreshing. I'd come back for the hotcakes even though they were so filling I couldn't finish them all, but I'd also like to try some of their savoury dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta Hotcakes
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Hibiscus and Lime soda

KXKafHVVAEIPkJME5xrnjA.text: Went for dinner and ordered a shrimp burger. It tastes alright but not worthy for its price. There aren't many choices from the menu either, so I guess this restaurant is better for brunch instead of dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

wiz6sgO0OLE2THpgnflicg.text: I had a great experience at Granger & Co. We were really lucky that we were only waiting around 10 minutes to be seated as by the time we left the restaurant, the queue outside was huge. Service was quick and friendly and I almost felt like I was on holiday sat at the breakfast bar counter! It was a great seat, I could see all around the restaurant and outside. It was a sunny day and with the big windows, it lights up the space. It would have been a nice touch to have some hooks for your handbag under the counter as it was a long way down to the floor when you wanted or your phone or purse! I ordered the avocado on rye with a poached egg. It was amazing! Really tasty, it went really well with the coriander and I don't even usually like coriander! My friend went for the salmon and really enjoyed it, that was a much bigger portion that mine. Do note that if they ask you if you want toast with your meal, it is an extra and not included as part of your meal, I think it was an extra £1.50 for a slice of toast. My friend and I shared a portion of hot cakes which were really tasty, fluffy and just the right thickness. It was nice to have the best of both worlds, sweet and savory without feeling too full. Although on the pricier side for your typical breakfast, I was really impressed and will definitely visit again if I have an early journey from Kings Cross.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast at the counter
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Hot cakes - thumbs up!
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Avocado on rye w/poached egg - delicious!

czxlD3J_513ePSOVSBqqGg.text: It's has a bit of a small space and you have to wait a bit in line for a table. Had their hotcakes which was very fluffy and good.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The Aussie
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The hotcakes

BTM4Xsr7hwLBKKlRXOZc2Q.text: Yum! really like this place. Coffee is good (which is a rarity for me) and the courgette fritters with halloumi, siyez & shredded kale salad, zhoug was super yummy...love love love..want to go back! oh, and my friend's pasta was also very flavoursome. def recommend going and on a nice sunny day, it's great to sit outside. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

xaLgBgbvUuENEVWqZo9jcA.text: Loved the vibe and food of this place. I was a bit skeptical bc it's a chain in kings x/St. Pancras and honestly it could've gone either way, but I have to say it's a decent spot.Got here at 11 or a bit earlier on a Sunday - MASSIVE queue out the door (side note: WTF is going on in this neighbourhood?! Every brunch spot has a queue out the door like they're giving food away - restaurant entrepreneurs open up more cafes in the area it's ripe for the picking!). Despite the scary queue, the nice waitress told us the wait would be about 20 mins - bearable.Not happy with this though bc it was freezing I asked about the bar seating and she said if we didn't mind the draft we could sit down right now. Done! So, because of yelp pics I knew I was getting the hot cakes, but I was trying to eat more veggies so we also got the corn fritters, a couple of coffees and a cheese and spinach scroll while we were waiting for good measure. Yes, I was hungry. Yes, it was too much.So, onto the food. The waiter messed up our hotcakes order but apologised and fixed it in a few minutes. It actually worked out bc we ate the fritters and then had he pancakes for dessert-ish. Both dishes were great and very different. Hot cakes were super fluffy and just what you want pancakes to be. Personally I thought they needed something tart to balance out the honeycomb butter and banana, maybe some berries. And some bacon.The coffee was delicious (allpress) but the milk for my americano was very cold and so my coffee got cold too fast. This happens to me all the time. Must ask for hot milk next time.To top it all off, the venue has a wonderful Art Deco/Wes Anderson vibe to it and free Sunday magazines to peruse while you wait.It's a solid spot for brunch and I'm now looking forward to trying their other meals!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Lovely flowers right in front of my seat
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Americano, milk poured (had to ask for a second)
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Fritters with the bacon on the side. Very tasty and not too heavy at all!

6tdxM1mN-Y5FeLQgt03ZgQ.text: This place was the highlight of my trip! The brunch was excellent. I ordered the Ricotta Hot Cakes, while my boyfriend got the Crab Kimchi Fried Rice. Both were amazing!! This place is a little on the expensive side but the food and service were excellent.

7Zoj47ytPh3Gy7QwAIUOfw.text: A great place for breakfast in the Kings Cross area. Really fresh food, which is light and refreshing. The place can get quite busy so reservations are recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The avocado on toast with poached egg had a very refreshing taste.
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta Pancakes were yummy!

tmkXMFqExsvijWMKt026-A.text: DO NOT EAT HERE. This restaurant discriminates against the disabled. I was traveling with my sister who requires the assistance of a service dog to alert for her medical conditions. Despite the dog wearing her vest, which clearly stated she was a service dog, and us explaining that she was a medical assistance dog and allowed in restaurants under the Equality Act of 2010, we were blown off by the employee and manager and told "pets" were not allowed. Absolutely unbelievable and illegal! Do not support such discrimination with your patronage. There are many other amazing restaurants in London which deserve your money. Check out Dishoom just down the road, where the staff couldn't have been more accommodating and understanding and the food was delicious!!

b-EkP2dQRTyeVAvQl4cXRg.text: I came here for Breakfast with a friend, around 9am which was great because it wasn't really too crowded and feel pretty quiet and nice.The restaurant decoration and atmosphere are nice, we had the chance with my friend to enjoy the bench seat.The service was ok, just was you can expect from waiter but nothing overratedWe ordered two different kind of toasts: the avocado ones with coriander for my friend and the poached eggs with tomatoes and sourdough toasts for me. It was good, fullfill but, as well, nothing really exceptionnel.The cappuccino there was good.It's a nice place for a relaxing breakfast which can be a good spot if you're around King'sCross Station area but I won't travel around London only for it. It was nice but a bit too pricy for the quality

a9c1E5EJUl6q259j8RNyPw.text: This place is a lovely find near St Pancras station the staff are friendly and the restaurant is cozy but modern. They have a nice drinks selection that isn't too pricy. We had the smashed cucumber starter which was tasty and I had the kimchi fried rice chorizo softshell crab bowl (so much yum!) my friend had the short rib Ragu also much loved. This place is lovely if your in town or early for a train give it a try!

2Xt-9fuRdJANV_5IGkqpKw.text: We went Sunday about 10am. Just a few minutes wait for a deuce, but larger parties had long waits. We saw quite a few groups choosing not to wait. I loved the recommended soft shell crab, kimchee, chorizo fried rice (though there was not much chorizo). Just spicy enough. OJ with a shot of ginger was an eye opener!  Will try it at home. My husband had zucchini fritter, kale, quinoa salad. Also excellent.   Miss the free coffee refills of US restaurants, but otherwise a great find.

M9VAbUraqdQhhVf4i_7pNA.text: I love this place. The decor and the setting with all the natural light is something else. The menu, as with all granger restaurants, is full of fresh, veg filled options and lots of flavours. The food here is seriously good but I've been here a couple of times now and sometimes the menu is slightly different to what happens on the plate. But I've never been disappointed! Lots of avocado, kale, fish and eggs. And seriously good cakes. Five stars for food.Booze list is ok. Wines are Australian focused and well made. Would love to see some craft Aussie beers here as there are some great ones in London. Four pillars gin is a must try.The reason why this doesn't get 4 stars + is because the staff are sooooooo relaxed. There is no sense of urgency and you really do need to flag them down even when it doesn't seem to be that busy. You're next to a train station: people may have a limited time. Right? They also seem to be very disappointed when you break it to them that you haven't booked for your coffee or breakfast. Refills of water jugs are as common as pink zebras. Anyway I'm torn but the food is so good and coffee is excellent so I think that wins.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The scrambled egg and kale roll with sourdough instead. I preferred the sourdough!

doTXAGlu9bHeX6vbAjKC0w.text: This is a beautiful restaurant bar that opens for breakfast, brunch and dinner with a fully stocked bar. It's set in the ever developing Kings Cross - wow, has this place transformed in the past few years! They were busy and didn't take bookings but we I went early and was able to secure a table for 8 for brunch on the comfy leather bench by the large windows. The staff were really lovely and the food tasted good but it gets 3 stars because we all felt that it was overpriced for what it was and we're all not full when we left!I had the crisp fried rice, which was a bib bim bap-inspired dish and beautifully presented. The hoisin chilli sauce really brought the dish together, however, I really could've eaten double that amount! At £12.50 with no meat, it was far too pricey! My friends all seemed to have the same experience; Simple, fresh dishes but we're all stingy portioned for the price we were paying.Was really excited to visit this place as I love Bill Granger's recipes and before we ate there, I was hoping there'd be a Granger and Co in Manchester soon but I can't see it catching on. For now, Manchester has a couple of Bill's to be getting on with!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Crisp Fried Rice - raw veg (courgettes, beetroot), arame, pickled onions, fried egg, sporting seeds with hoisin chilli sauce
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Sweet corn fritters, roasted tomatoes, spinach and bacon at 13.50
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Toasted rye with avocado, lime, coriander and poached egg at 8.75

XjUUZ-DaBF2ajB7zVmxo4w.text: Ricotto hot cakes are really good. Seats were immediately  available on the bar on a saturday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

sC717-7TzY7BjrA1rZhHLg.text: Was this place overpriced? A tad yes. But was the food good? Hell yes! I had the chicken schnitzel and not only was it tasty it was a generous portion that left me feeling very full. I was very surprised by the selection of wine on offer - they had Australian (naturally - it is an Aussie restaurant), but also Italian and French (was also happy to see Picpoul De Pinet - which seems to be harder to come by these days). Upon arrival - it was jam packed - but I cannot express how happy I was with the service! They seated us at the bar and kept us informed about how long the wait would be for a table (which as it turned out, wasn't too long).  Everyone was so friendly despite being super packed (people were literally queuing around the corner to get in).  By the time we finished our first drink - boom! A lovely table was available.   The waitress we had was really lovely and helpful - she was able to recommend different beers on offer, explain some of the things on the menu and was super nice. My only negative about this restaurant - they don't take reservations. But I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Some sort of ale called Neck Oil (funky can)
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Pistachio and chocolate fudge
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel ice cream

82LTC9n3XoZ4vUjJBXf-BA.text: WHAT AN INCREDIBLE BRUNCH!!! The ricotta pancakes with bananas are literally heavenly, the chorizo that comes with delicious poached eggs was perfectly cooked and flavourful and any place that serves a latte with house made almond milk is something special. The service was friendly and attentive (not overly normal for London) and I can't wait to go back!

NUrc5DQp4ZmXfM55IbfZXg.text: I give this place 3 stars because it's too much of a hit & miss in terms of service. The food is great though. The first time we came here for breakfast it was great, and the second time, getting served at the bar, it was awful. What's awful, you might ask? Awful is when you sit down, order a coffee and breakfast and then wait 20 minutes to get that coffee from the bar staff and your breakfast is obviously nowhere in view. Oh, and after the coffee was set in front of you, you actually wait more before you can finally sip it because they didn't think you might require sugar/sweetener. Not a pleasant service experience. On the food front, this is an Australian business and the menu reflects it with its choice of products. It's more on the healthy side.The ricotta hot cakes are simply a treat, they are perfect and come in a generous serving. Other food items looked very fresh and tasty as well. Eep in mind the prices are relatively high here for what you get, so those looking for better value won't find it here. Would we be back? Not with so many other choices around, but maybe now and again.
